titleStmt.title: Bericht über ein Fest der Deutschen Arbeiter-Gesellschaft

sourceDesc.bibl: [Engels, Friedrich?:] Bericht über ein Fest der Deutschen Arbeiter-Gesellschaft. In: Northern Star. Vol. XI. Nr. 535, 22. Januar 1848. S. 7.

seriesStmt.title: The Northern Star, and National Trades’ Journal

div.p: Brussels. — A few days ago the German Working Men’s Society celebrated a festival. The foreign democracies were represented by M.M. Lelewell, Imbert, General Mellinet, Picard, Meskens, and others. The following toasts were drunk: — To the “Association Democratique of Brussels”, by Dr Marx. To the “German Working Men’s Society”, by M. Picard, (Belgian). To “the Polish patriot Lelewel”, by M. Bornstedt, editor of the German Brussels Gazette. To “the union of freed Germany and freed Poland”, by Lelewel. To “the Brussels German Gazette”, by M. Wolff. To “the two foreign Democratic papers, the Northern Star and the Reforme”, by M. Gigot. Other Speeches were delivered by M.M. Born, Junge, &c. A democratic play was performed, and the banquet ended by dancing, which was continued to an early hour.
